intro: Nototriche coccinea, commonly known as the red-flowered nototriche, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red petals and yellow central disk, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, forming a basal rosette. Nototriche coccinea is often found in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
